1.text: â€œBut now they mock me, men younger than I am, whose fathers I would have refused to put with my sheep dogs.

2.text: What use to me was the strength of their hands, since their vigor had left them?

3.text: Gaunt from poverty and hunger, they gnawed the dry land, and the desolate wasteland by night.

4.text: They plucked mallow among the shrubs, and the roots of the broom tree were their food.

5.text: They were banished from among men, shouted at like thieves,

6.text: so that they lived on the slopes of the wadis, among the rocks and in holes in the ground.

7.text: They cried out among the shrubs and huddled beneath the nettles.

8.text: A senseless and nameless brood, they were driven off the land.

9.text: And now they mock me in song; I have become a byword among them.

10.text: They abhor me and keep far from me; they do not hesitate to spit in my face.

11.text: Because God has unstrung my bow and afflicted me, they have cast off restraint in my presence.

12.text: The rabble arises at my right; they lay snares for my feet and build siege ramps against me.

13.text: They tear up my path; they profit from my destruction, with no one to restrain them.

14.text: They advance as through a wide breach; through the ruins they keep rolling in.

15.text: Terrors are turned loose against me; they drive away my dignity as by the wind, and my prosperity has passed like a cloud.

16.text: And now my soul is poured out within me; days of affliction grip me.

17.text: Night pierces my bones, and my gnawing pains never rest.

18.text: With great force He grasps my garment; He seizes me by the collar of my tunic.

19.text: He throws me into the mud, and I have become like dust and ashes.

20.text: I cry out to You for help, but You do not answer; when I stand up, You merely look at me.

21.text: You have ruthlessly turned on me; You oppose me with Your strong hand.

22.text: You snatch me up into the wind and drive me before it; You toss me about in the storm.

23.text: Yes, I know that You will bring me down to death, to the place appointed for all the living.

24.text: Yet no one stretches out his hand against a ruined man when he cries for help in his distress.

25.text: Have I not wept for those in trouble? Has my soul not grieved for the needy?

26.text: But when I hoped for good, evil came; when I looked for light, darkness fell.

27.text: I am churning within and cannot rest; days of affliction confront me.

28.text: I go about blackened, but not by the sun. I stand up in the assembly and cry for help.

29.text: I have become a brother of jackals, a companion of ostriches.

30.text: My skin grows black and peels, and my bones burn with fever.

31.text: My harp is tuned to mourning and my flute to the sound of weeping.
